skill.name: architect
skill.description: Design systems, plan implementations, review architecture decisions - Use when you need to plan a complex feature, design system architecture, or make high-level technical decisions.
skill.summary: Design systems, plan implementations, review architecture decisions - Use when you need to plan a co...
skill.author: 0xSero

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, filesystem access, network capabilities, or external command execution. All tools are explicitly disabled (write: false, edit: false, bash: false).

content.value_statement: Complex software projects often suffer from unclear requirements and architectural decisions made without proper trade-off analysis. This skill provides structured guidance for system design, helping you clarify requirements, compare alternatives, and identify risks before implementation begins.
actual_capabilities: Clarify requirements and constraints before proposing solutions
Compare architectural alternatives with clear pros and cons
Identify risks, dependencies, and phased rollout options
Provide structured architecture plans and overviews
limitations: Cannot access or analyze your actual codebase directly
Cannot make architectural changes to your project
Cannot integrate with external design tools or diagrams
Provides guidance only - you must implement decisions yourself

use_cases.title: Plan New Features
use_cases.description: Design the architecture for new features before writing code, avoiding costly refactoring later.

use_cases.title: Review Architecture
use_cases.description: Evaluate proposed designs and identify potential risks or technical debt before stakeholder alignment.

use_cases.title: Assess Trade-offs
use_cases.description: Understand the implications of different architectural choices for project planning and resource allocation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Design Request
prompt_templates.scenario: Need architecture for a new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me design the architecture for a [feature type] that needs to [primary function]. What are the key components and how should they interact?

prompt_templates.title: Compare Options
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare [option A] vs [option B] for [use case]. Include pros, cons, and recommendations for when each approach is best.

prompt_templates.title: Risk Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this architecture design [describe design] and identify potential risks, dependencies, and failure modes.

prompt_templates.title: Phased Rollout
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a phased rollout plan for [system] that minimizes risk and allows for early validation at each stage.

output_examples.input: Help me design the architecture for a real-time notification system.
output: Key Components: Publisher, Message Queue, Notification Service, Delivery Handlers, User Preferences Store
Trade-offs: Push vs Polling, At-least-once vs Exactly-once delivery, Sync vs Async processing
Risks: Message ordering, delivery failures, scale bottlenecks, user preference consistency
Phased Approach: Start with sync notifications, add queue for scale, implement retry logic, then optimize

best_practices: Start by clarifying requirements and constraints before discussing specific implementations
Always consider multiple alternatives and their trade-offs rather than jumping to one solution
Identify dependencies and risks early to avoid surprises during implementation
anti_patterns: Jumping to a specific technology solution without understanding requirements first
Ignoring operational concerns like monitoring, failure handling, and scalability
Making architectural decisions without documenting the reasoning and trade-offs

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for architecture planning and design discussions.

faq.question: What are the input size limits?
faq.answer: There are no specific limits - provide as much context about your system as needed for accurate analysis.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my codebase?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance through conversation. You apply the recommendations to your code yourself.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only processes conversation context locally - no data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if the suggestions do not work?
faq.answer: Review the trade-offs and risks section. Adjust based on your specific constraints and iterate on the design.

faq.question: How does this compare to hiring a consultant?
faq.answer: This provides structured guidance instantly. Complex decisions still benefit from human expertise for final alignment.
